org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.projects

Class LibraryPathManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.projects.LibraryPathManager

  • public final class LibraryPathManager
extends Object
    Manages the library path of a ASProject. It has a list of SWC file handles discovered on the library path. The manager doesn't keep SWC models, because the SWCManager keep them as SoftReference. SWCManager is responsible for providing a ISWC model from a file.

    • Method Detail

      • isSWCFile

        public static boolean isSWCFile(File file)

      • discoverSWCFilePaths

        public static Set<FileID> discoverSWCFilePaths(File[] libraryPath)
        Find all the SWC files on the library path. The given library path entries can be a SWC file or a directory containing SWC files. Note that it does NOT read the directories recursively. Returns FileID objects so we can be sure that we have not accidenly made a case sensitive comparison

      • discoverSWCFilePathsAsFiles

        public static Set<File> discoverSWCFilePathsAsFiles(File[] libraryPath)
        like discoverSWCFilePaths, but returns File instead of FileID. Only needed for extrenal clients who don't / shouldn't have access to FileID
        Parameters:
        libraryPath - An array of File objects.

      • setLibraryPath

        public void setLibraryPath(File[] libraryPath)
        Set the library path. It will populate SWCManager with SWC files found on the library path. It also creates SWCCompilationUnit objects for the discovered SWC files, and add these compilation units to the project.

        It is optimized to do nothing when the new library path is same as the existing setting. See setLibrarySourcePath() as to why discoverSWCFilePaths() just ignores invalid entries in the path

        Parameters:
        libraryPath - the File on the library path can be a SWC file or a directory containing SWC files.

      • setLibrarySourcePath

        public void setLibrarySourcePath(File library,
                        File sourceDir)
        Set the source path of a SWC library.
        Parameters:
        library - SWC file path
        sourceDir - source directory Note if we are passed a bad path here, we just ignore it. This happens often when Projects have stale/strange lib source paths. We COULD try to log a problem, but Bruce and Chris discussed this, and it seems like overkill, as this only affects code hinting.

      • getAttachedSourceDirectory

        public String getAttachedSourceDirectory(String libraryFilename)
        Find the directory were a given library might live. Normally used for finding source attachments.
        Parameters:
        libraryFilename - name of a library we want to find
        Returns:
        a String with the full path to the folder.

      • getAttachedSourceFilename

        public static String getAttachedSourceFilename(String sourceDirectory,
                               String qualifiedName)
        Finds a source file in the source directory for the specified qualified name.
        Parameters:
        sourceDirectory - Path to directory where source attachment directory should be exist.
        qualifiedName - Dotted qualified name to find a source file for.
        Returns:
        Absolute file name of for specified dotted qualified name in the specified library file.

      • getLibrarySourcePath

        public File getLibrarySourcePath(File library)
        Get source path for a SWC library.
        Parameters:
        library - SWC file
        Returns:
        Directory that contains the source for a SWC library; Null if the source path hasn't been set.

      • getLibrarySWCs

        protected com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<ISWC> getLibrarySWCs()
        Get ISWC objects for the SWC files on the library path. LibraryPathManager does not keep a list of all the SWC model.
        Returns:
        A list of ISWC's on the library path.

      • invalidate

        protected boolean invalidate(Collection<File> swcFiles)
        Invalidate a collection of SWC files on the library path.
        Parameters:
        swcFiles - SWC files on the library path
        Returns:
        true if a library referenced by the project was invalidated

      • invalidate

        protected void invalidate(ISWC swc)
        Invalidate a SWC on the library path.
        Parameters:
        swc - ISWC to invalidate

        public ISWCFileEntry getFileEntryFromLibraryPath(String filename)
        Search the library path for file entries matching the filename
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename to search for
        Returns:
        ISWCFileEntry or null if not found
